summary: In this context, 1,4-dichlorobenzene is identified as a specific chemical frequently detected in sewage treatment effluent (STE) due to its historical use in various domestic products. It is characterized as a less biodegradable volatile organic compound (VOC) and serves as a chemical indicator for VOCs in water treatment processes. The discussion emphasizes its relevance in monitoring and assessing the health risks associated with recycled water, linking it to broader chemical concerns in environmental contexts.
